title: Hotel ousts singer Gretchen Wilson following noise...
text:
In August 2018, the country singer was arrested at a Connecticut airport after what was described as a minor disturbance on an incoming flight and later charged with breach of peace.

And Sunday morning, Gretchen Wilson was asked to leave the Hotel Encanto de Las Cruces following multiple noise complaints, according to the Las Cruces Sun-News.

Gretchen, 46, took to her Twitter after the incident and called for her fans to 'all band together' to put the hotel 'out of business' because she 'had to wait 2 hrs for breakfast' and 'then they sent police to kick me out in the middle of the night for no reason.'

Shocking: Gretchen Wilson was asked to leave the Hotel Encanto de Las Cruces following multiple noise complaints, according to the Las Cruces Sun-News; pictured on November 14, 2018 at the 52nd Annual CMA Awards in Nashville, Tennessee

She added: 'I complied. Home early.'

Gretchen was in town to headline the 7th annual Las Cruces Country Music Festival (LCCMF), which took place Friday, October 11 until Sunday, October 13.

After she was kicked out, the musician tweeted the hotel asked her to leave 'in the middle of the night for no reason.'

She also called on her Twitter followers to 'all band together to put Hotel Encanto out of business.'

Her request: She also called on her Twitter followers to 'all band together to put Hotel Encanto out of business;' the hotel pictured

Her side: Gretchen was in town to perform at the 7th annual Las Cruces Country Music Festival, where she hit the stage on Saturday; pictured on April 22, 2017 in Nashville

Yikes: Gretchen, 46, took to her Twitter after the incident and called for her fans to 'all band together' to put the hotel 'out of business' because she 'had to wait 2 hrs for breakfast' and 'then they sent police to kick me out in the middle of the night for no reason'

Adding: 'I got off stage at 11:30 pm. At 12:30 pm [sic] I was only talking in my room. The hotel informed me that QUIET HOURS started at 10 pm. Wrong hotel for 3rd shifters.'

In a 911 call, a hotel employee said Wilson's volume level for talking was the equivalent of yelling and that they had received multiple noise complaints against her.

The newspaper reported that the employee said: 'We went up there multiple times the last half hour. So, I went up there and she said she was a celebrity but I forgot to get her name.'

What happened: In a 911 call, a hotel employee said Wilson's volume level for talking was the equivalent of yelling and that they had received multiple noise complaints against her; Gretchen pictured December 8, 2018 performing in Phoenix, Arizona

Adding: 'Gretchen something, she participated in the country music festival and her words were, "I paid for the room, I could care less what people think." We had her escorted off property.'

They told the newspaper that the singer was being 'super loud' but didn't have her television or any music on in the room.

Las Cruces Police Department spokesman Dan Trujillo said the guest had 'worn out their welcome' and police helped security remove her, the paper reported.

Wow: They told the newspaper that the singer was being 'super loud' but didn't have her television or any music on in the room; the hotel pictured

'(Police) were going to issue a trespass card but the occupants agreed to leave,' he said.

A trespass card is given to a person suspected of trespassing and the person signs it as acknowledgment that if they continue to trespass, they could possibly get charged with a crime.

He added that the incident occurred a little after 3 am on Sunday morning.

Trouble: Las Cruces Police Department spokesman Dan Trujillo said Wilson, 46, and other guests had 'worn out their welcome' and police helped security remove them, the paper reported; pictured November 14, 2018

The Sun-News reached out to a representative for Wilson for a comment but didn't receive one at press time.

They also contacted Hotel Encanto and LCCMF organizers but both declined to comment.

In August 2018, Wilson was arrested at a Connecticut airport after what was described as a minor disturbance on an incoming flight American Airlines flight, according to CNN.

She was later charged with a misdemeanor for second-degree breach of peace and had a bond set at $1,000.

Gretchen settled the case with a $500 donation to charity, NBC Connecticut reported.

She had said about the ordeal to the new site: 'This has been incredibly trying for me in many ways.'
description: In August 2018, the country singer was arrested at an airport in Connecticut. And on Sunday Gretchen Wilson was asked to leave a hotel, according to the Las Cruces Sun-News.
